config.question: What was one important difference between the founding of the Virginia and Maryland colonies?

choices.content: Virginia was founded as an economic venture, while Maryland was intended partly to secure religious freedom for persecuted Roman Catholics.
Virginia colonists were willing to come only if they could acquire their own land, while Maryland colonists labored for their landlords.
Virginia depended primarily on its tobacco economy, while Maryland turned to rice cultivation.
Virginia depended on African slave labor, while Maryland relied mainly on white indentured servitude.

answer_3.response: Virginia was established by a joint-stock company as an economic venture that eventually led to the growth of tobacco as a cash crop. Maryland was initially set up by Lord Baltimore as a haven for Roman Catholics persecuted in England.
